raw_text:
# Approved Projects - City of El Segundo

## Overview
Here you can find additional information on Approved Planning Projects within the City of El Segundo. For all general inquiries and related matters, please visit our [EZ Permit Hub](https://elsegundoca.portal.opengov.com/categories/1078) to submit any inquiries to Planning Division.

To sign up for updates related to zoning, projects, CEQA, Planning Commission, and other planning topics please click [here](https://public.govdelivery.com/accounts/CAELSEGUNDO/subscriber/new).

## Approved Projects

### 444 North Nash Street - Mitigated Negative Declaration (EA-971 Revision A)
**Current Status:** Approved by Planning Commission on March 23, 2023. Project is currently under construction and anticipated to be completed by end of 2024.

**Project Details:** In 2012, approval was granted to allow a data centers and emergency backup diesel generators (EA-971). On March 23, 2023, the Planning Commission approved an amendment that increased the total number of allowable backup generators to 15 (EA-971 Revision A). Specifically, the Project proposes to install up to 7 generators will be installed at the property's northeast corner - three at ground level and four on platforms. There is no change in land use or expansion in building floor area.

**Supporting Documents:**
- Public Review IS/MND
- Mitigation Monitoring and Reporting Program
- Responses to Comments MND
- Modeling Technical Memorandum

### New Drive-Thru Starbucks within Nash Street Exchange Retail Development (Chargers Commons - EA-1200 Revision B)
**Current Status:** Conditionally approved by Planning Commission on July 27, 2023. Project is currently under construction and anticipated to be completed by end of 2024.

**Project Details:** Site Plan Review and Conditional Use Permit to allow a third drive-through at phase 1 and construction of a new one-story drive-through restaurant within the El Segundo Southeast Campus Specific Plan Area (Lot 16 and Vesting Tentative Tract Map 83507).

**Supporting Documents:**
- Proposed Project Plans
- EA-1200 Revision B: Trip Generation Memo
- EA-1200 Revision B: Revised Trip Generation Memo
- EA-1200 Revision B: Drive-Through Queuing Analysis

### Pacific Coast Commons (EA-1248)
**Current Status:** On March 15, 2022 and April 19, 2022, the City Council approved the Pacific Coast Commons project. To-date the developer has not started construction of the project.

**Project Details:** The approved mixed-use project includes a total of 257 apartment units, 6 townhome condominium units, 11,252 square feet of commercial uses, and three parking structures containing 825 parking spaces in various districts/subareas along PCH. Of the total 263 residential units, 32 are approved as affordable housing units.

To implement development of the project, a Specific Plan was approved for the area bounded by PCH, Holly Avenue, Indiana Street, and Palm Avenue, and bisected by Mariposa Avenue. The specific plan created five land use districts (or subareas) for the area and includes carefully tailored land use regulations within each district.

**Supporting Documents:**
- PCC Project - Frequently asked questions
- Pacific Coast Commons Specific Plan Draft Environmental Impact Report
- Pacific Coast Commons DEIR Appendices
- Mitigation Monitoring and Reporting Program
- Pacific Coast Commons Final EIR
- Findings of Fact and Statement of Overriding Consideration
- Project Plans

### Standard Works Project (EA-1281+1282)
**Current Status:** Approved by City Council on March 15, 2022, the North site is currently under construction; and the South site is pending permit issuance.

**Project Details:** The approved development for the South Site (located at 1475 East El Segundo Boulevard) includes a 44,604 square foot two-story addition to an existing one-story brick building, resulting in a 63,915 square foot three-story building with an overall height of 59'-6".

The North Site is located on a 1.07-acre portion of a larger property at 1320-1330 East Franklin Avenue. The approved development incudes a 44,802 square foot two-story addition to an existing one-story brick building, resulting in a 65,061 square foot three-story building with an overall height of 59'-6"; a new 766 square foot coffee pavilion with a maximum height of 23'-8"; and, a new 5,000-square foot public outdoor park with park seating, picnic tables, shade trees and landscaping.

**Supporting Documents:**
- Standard Works Initial Study Public Draft
- Mitigation Monitoring and Reporting Program
- Technical Studies
- Master Sign Program
- Proposed Development Plans (North)
- Proposed Development Plans (South)

### 650-700 North Pacific Coast Highway (EA-1289)
**Current Status:** On May 23, 2024, the Planning Commission approved a second one-year time extension to the previously approved Vesting Tentative Parcel Map. The map was extended to expire on May 18, 2025.

**Project Description:** Consolidation of seven parcels into a single lot and construction of a new 70,921 square-foot 7-story office building with an integrated 1,185-space parking structure.

**Supporting Documents:**
- Planning Commission Resolution No. 2952 (2nd Map Extension)
- Final MND (with Technical Studies)
- Draft MND
- Proposed Development Plans

### 1950-1960 E. Grand Ave Project (EA-1291)
**Current Status:** On June 29, 2022, the El Segundo Planning Commission conditionally approved the 1950-1960 E Grand Avenue Project.

**Project Details**: The approved Project includes construction of a new 5-story commercial office building (4-story with mezzanine) and a new 23-space surface parking lot at 1950 East Grand Avenue, and a 4-level, 258-space parking structure at 1960 East Grand Avenue. The new office building will be located at the front of the parcel, replacing the existing surface parking spaces.

**Supporting Documents:**
- 1950-1960 E. Grand Ave Project Draft MND
- 1950-1960 E Grand Ave Project Final MND
- 1950-1960 E Grand Ave Project Plans

### Beach Cities Media Campus Project (EA-1339)
**Current Status:** On September 14, 2023, the El Segundo Planning Commission conditionally approved the Beach Cities Media Campus Project.

**Project Details:** Construct a new seven-story, 182,654 square-foot (gross floor area) office and a five-level 703-space parking structure. The proposed project effectuates both the Primary Project and Alternative 3 development scenario of the DA approved through EA-1201 which also certified Environmental Impact Report (EIR) for the development of the property.

**Supporting Documents:**
- Beach Cities Proposed Project Plans
- Beach Cities MND

### Smoky Hollow Parking Structure (Franklin Street and Maryland Street)
**Current Status:** Under construction, anticipated to be completed in 2025.

**Project Details:** A new 4-level parking garage measuring 41.6 feet high that replaces a surface parking lot. The structure will accommodate 274 parking spaces, and access to the structure will be via Lomita Street.

**Supporting Documents:**
- Smoky Hollow Parking Structure Plans

### LA Times Gallery and Archive Building
**Current Status:** Building permit COM-24-159 issued May 14, 2024; under construction expected completion in 2025.

**Project Details:** A new 27,938 gross square feet 3-story multi-use building for Los Angeles Times.

**Supporting Documents:**
- LA Times Project Plans

### 2180 East Grand Avenue
**Current Status:** Building permit COM-24-13 issued June 6, 2024; under construction expected completion in 2025.

**Project Details:** A new 10-story building consisting of 8 levels of parking with 2 levels of office above. The parking garage will accommodate over 900 parking spaces, and the upper two levels accommodate approximately 49,500 square feet of office space.

structured_data.other_info: The page provides detailed information about multiple approved development projects in El Segundo, including their current status, project descriptions, and supporting documentation. Projects include data centers, retail developments, mixed-use developments, office buildings, and parking structures. For general inquiries, residents can visit the EZ Permit Hub to submit inquiries to the Planning Division.
